inclusion.criterion: Written informed consent prior to enrolment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Male or female, aged between 18-65 years old
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus for more than 12 months, on insulin, on a stable dose for 60 days prior to screening
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Available clinical records for the past 12 months, regarding medical treatment for diabetes and A1c evaluations
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A1c >7.5 % in the 60 days prior to screening
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Discrepancies between A1c and glycaemic levels (the log book not reflecting the A1c result) that justify the clinical decision of pCGM future use
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Decision to use Carelink iPro must precede enrollment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ability to adhere to protocol requirements
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The patient reports that he is currently homeless and has lost his supply of insulin, syringes, glucometer, and glucose testing supplies
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: The patient states that at the time of his initial diagnosis with type 1 diabetes he was hospitalized with a glucose value >1000 mg/dL
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Most recently, he has been using insulin glargine 55 units once daily, and insulin aspart sliding scale 3 times daily
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The patient has had previous episodes of diabetic ketoacidosis, for which he was hospitalized
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Pregnant or planning to become pregnant during the course of the study
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Continuous Glucose Monitoring use by any device or manufacturer in the year prior to screening
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Serious or unstable medical or psychological condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, would compromise the subject's safety or successful participation in the study
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Inability to comply with study requirements
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 24-year-old man who has had type 1 diabetes for 11 years. He presents to the emergency room with hyperglycemia and concern for possible diabetic ketoacidosis after not taking his insulin for 3 days.
